subject: RE: [junit] How to record test results in XML format

messageBody:
go to http://jakarta.apache.org/ant
download a binary (which includes documentation)
set up your build script (read the documentation)
run it (read the documentation)

A simple build script may be (you'll want to replace all the hardcoded
paths to properties):

<project name="MyProject" default="tests">
<path id="somePath">
<pathelement location="lib/sub1/some1.jar"/>
<pathelement location="lib/sub2/some2.jar"/>
<pathelement location="lib/sub3/some3.jar"/>
</path>

<target name="tests" depends="build">
<junit printsummary="yes" haltonfailure="no">
<classpath refid="somePath"/>

<formatter type="xml"/>

<batchtest fork="yes" todir="reports">
<fileset dir="build"/>
</batchtest>
</junit>

<junitreport todir="reports">
<fileset dir="reports">
<include name="TEST-*.xml"/>
</fileset>
<report format="frames" todir="reports"/>
</junitreport>
</target>

<target name="build">
<javac
srcdir="src"
destdir="build">
<classpath refid="somePath"/>
</javac>
</target>
</project>
